summary: To help small businesses affected by COVID-19 , the Small Business Administration gave low-interest Economic Injury Disaster Loans and grants to millions of applicants. These funds totaled $224 billion as of February 2021. But SBA didn't give applicants key information like processing time, loan limits, or status updates—causing confusion and uncertainty for applicants. Also, the program is susceptible to payment errors. SBA approved at least...
title: Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program: Additional Actions Needed to Improve Communication with Applicants and Address Fraud Risks
